feed.title: New Zealand Emergency Mobile Alert feed
feed.subtitle: A feed of current or recent Emergency Mobile Alerts issued in New Zealand.

entry.title: TSUNAMI - National Advisory BEACH AND MARINE
entry.summary:
TSUNAMI ADVISORY: Strong and unusual currents and unpredictable surges at the shore are expected following a magnitude 8.8 earthquake near Kamchatka, Russia.
Strong currents and surges can injure and drown people. There is a danger to swimmers, surfers, people fishing, and anyone in or near the water close to the shore.
People on boats, live-aboards and at marinas should leave their boats/vessels and move onto shore. Do not return to boats unless instructed by officials.
IF YOU ARE ONSHORE, YOU DO NOT NEED TO EVACUATE. But STAY AWAY FROM THE WATER, including beaches, shore areas, harbours, marinas, rivers and estuaries. DO NOT GO SIGHTSEEING.
This advisory is for all coastal areas of the North Island, Great Barrier Island, the South Island, Stewart Island and the Chatham Islands.
For more information go to www.civildefence.govt.nz
Issued by the National Emergency Management Agency at 4:12pm 30/07/2025.

This advisory is for all coastal areas of the North Island, Great Barrier Island, the South Island, Stewart Island and the Chatham Islands.

entry.title: Tsunami Advisory to upper Lyttelton Harbour
entry.content:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <alert xmlns="urn:oasis:names:tc:emergency:cap:1.2"><identifier>2.49.0.0.554.2.12.407.406</identifier><sender>info@cdemcanterbury.govt.nz</sender><sent>2025-07-30T22:13:40-00:00</sent><status>Actual</status><msgType>Cancel</msgType><scope>Public</scope><references>info@cdemcanterbury.govt.nz,2.49.0.0.554.2.12.406.406,2025-07-30T18:33:29-00:00</references><info><language>en-US</language><category>Geo</category><event>Tsunami</event><urgency>Immediate</urgency><severity>Severe</severity><certainty>Observed</certainty><effective>2025-07-30T22:13:40-00:00</effective><expires>2025-07-30T22:13:40-00:00</expires><senderName>Canterbury Civil Defence Emergency Management Group</senderName><headline>Tsunami Advisory to upper Lyttelton Harbour</headline><description>TSUNAMI ADVISORY: Strong currents and surges are occurring after the M8.8 earthquake near Russia. These currents and surges can injure or drown people. Stay away from beaches, shorelines, harbours, rivers, and estuaries.DO NOT GO SIGHTSEEING.
People with boats and live-aboards should remain onshore unless directed otherwise. IF YOU ARE ONSHORE, EVACUATION IS NOT REQUIRED, but STAY AWAY FROM WATER.
This advisory applies to all coastal areas of NZ. The threat is likely to remain in force until at least midday today.
Tsunami activity has already reached parts of NZ. Initial surges may not be the largest, and activity could continue for hours. Treat the threat as real until the advisory is cancelled.
For updates, visit www.civildefence.govt.nz.
Issued by Emergency Management Canterbury at 6:33am 31/07/2025.</description><area><areaDesc>Alert area</areaDesc><polygon>-43.58995,172.69023 -43.60144,172.63995 -43.66187,172.63341 -43.68722,172.6882 -43.65047,172.74277 -43.58995,172.69023</polygon></area></info></alert>
entry.summary:
TSUNAMI ADVISORY: Strong currents and surges are occurring after the M8.8 earthquake near Russia. These currents and surges can injure or drown people. Stay away from beaches, shorelines, harbours, rivers, and estuaries.DO NOT GO SIGHTSEEING.
People with boats and live-aboards should remain onshore unless directed otherwise. IF YOU ARE ONSHORE, EVACUATION IS NOT REQUIRED, but STAY AWAY FROM WATER.
This advisory applies to all coastal areas of NZ. The threat is likely to remain in force until at least midday today.
Tsunami activity has already reached parts of NZ. Initial surges may not be the largest, and activity could continue for hours. Treat the threat as real until the advisory is cancelled.
For updates, visit www.civildefence.govt.nz.
Issued by Emergency Management Canterbury at 6:33am 31/07/2025.
